article_title: Alaska Attorney General's office fights House-led appeal in Medicaid lawsuit
article_text: On May 5, the Legislature's outside attorneys filed the appeal in Supreme Court, naming the Legislative Council as the appellant. However, the council never voted to continue the case, and under an opinion by the Legislature's lawyer, the council had no authority to decide on the appeal even if it wanted to. The legal opinion said the Legislative Council's authority to sue expired when the full Legislature went into session, and the Senate and House would have to vote on continuing the case.

article_metadata.description: The Alaska Attorney General's office says the Alaska House lacks the authority to substitute itself for a legislative committee in the appeal of a lower court's decision to allow Gov. Walker's Medicaid expansion.

og.description: The Alaska Attorney General's office says the Alaska House lacks the authority to substitute itself for a legislative committee in the appeal of a lower court's decision to allow Gov. Walker's Medicaid expansion.
og.title: Alaska Attorney General's office fights House-led appeal in Medicaid lawsuit

article_summary:
On May 5, the Legislature's outside attorneys filed the appeal in Supreme Court, naming the Legislative Council as the appellant.
However, the council never voted to continue the case, and under an opinion by the Legislature's lawyer, the council had no authority to decide on the appeal even if it wanted to.
The legal opinion said the Legislative Council's authority to sue expired when the full Legislature went into session, and the Senate and House would have to vote on continuing the case.
